name: UNESCO Chair of Lucian Blaga University of Sibiu
memberOrga:
On matters pertaining to Lifelong Learning and the Quality Management of Higher Education, the UNESCO Chair is not only unique in Romania and Europe but also operates among only 23 other UNESCO/UNITWIN Chairs on Higher Education and Lifelong Learning in the whole world. 
https://en.unesco.org/sites/default/files/list-unesco-chairs.pdf
goal:
For the next four years (2019-2023), the UNESCO Chair will continue to contribute to identifying and sustaining actions needed for the strengthening of HE-graduate employment/employers links in Romania, the increased assurance of the quality of learning and competencies provided by higher education in the country, the provision of skills for lifelong learning as well as the improvement of the employability rate among graduates.
Obtaining a quality education is the foundation to creating sustainable development. Rallying to the SDG nr 4, Quality of Education, our UNESCO Chair's main goal will be to ensure inclusive and quality education for all and promote lifelong learning. With a firm belief in the fact that Education is the key that will allow many other Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to be achieved, our Chair will act in support of Education to reduce inequalities and to reach gender equality. Education empowers people everywhere to live more healthy and sustainable lives, being crucial to fostering tolerance between people and to building more peaceful societies. In this context, the mission of the UNESCO Chair will continue to be geared towards better serving not only the needs of our students, graduates and learners but also the needs of the wider regional community for more diversified learning programs (re-skilling courses, modules, and curricula programmes), adult education and continuing professional education programs that have emerged along with the new labour market demands and different job profiles.
With a view to the above, for the 2019-2023, the specific responsibilities of our UNESCO Chair will be the following:

1. Adopting the mantle of the civic university – pursuing the ‘public good’ by aligning its interests with those of society, and working collaboratively with other HEIs to maximize their collective impact;
2. Maintaining a proactive role in ensuring that the SDGs are included in local agendas, proposing changes to education, and engaging with local and global communities on sustainable development;
3. Educating the SDG Generation needed to make the SDGs a reality, thereby helping to produce new SDG leaders;
4. Building capacities for SDG policies, planning and management;
5. Encouraging trans-disciplinarity and refinements of curricula to ensure the mainstreaming of SDG issues across curricula, and including new values and practices for economic development that enhance social equity.
interests: Communication, Culture, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, External Relations, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Migration and asylum, Research and innovation, Youth
